name: UNBOUND Gravel 100

distances.name: 100 Mile
distances.description: Half the distance of the legendary 200-mile course through Kansas Flint Hills

terrain: Kansas Flint Hills gravel roads - sharp flint rock surface, rolling hills, minimal shade, exposed prairie terrain
registration: Lottery-based registration in November, entry fee $245
weather: Kansas summer conditions - temperatures 85-95Â°F, high humidity, full sun exposure, potential thunderstorms
uniqueCharacteristics: Part of the UNBOUND Gravel festival weekend
Same challenging Flint Hills terrain as the 200-mile race
Ideal introduction to UNBOUND for first-timers
Rolling hills create relentless elevation profile
Sharp flint rocks notorious for causing flats
Finishes in downtown Emporia with festival atmosphere
Lottery entry system like the 200-mile race
Aid stations at key points on course
popularity: Very High - part of world's largest gravel event
